image.altText: ACT Australian of the Year Rose McGready.

props.synopsis: Rose McGready has been living in a refugee camp for more than 30 years, having dedicated her life to saving the lives of vulnerable women and children.

title.children: Refugee health expert named ACT Australian of the Year

image.altText: The Woden School sign on a building.

props.synopsis: More schools will reopen in Canberra on Wednesday with a list of current closures to be updated this afternoon.

title.children: List of ACT schools reopening tomorrow as coloured sand clean-up continues

image.altText: Outside a modern court building.

props.synopsis: In 2022, a woman died after being run over by a ute outside her house. The legal case about exactly what happened and who's responsible is now heading to the High Court.

title.children: Contest over murder, manslaughter or freedom heads to High Court

image.altText: Gloved hands use tweezers to examine pink coloured sand in a zip-lock bag.

props.synopsis: Dozens of schools remain closed in the ACT, Tasmania and South Australia today as the clean-up and disposal of potentially asbestos-laced coloured sand continues. What risk does it actually pose?

title.children: 'Don't panic': Asbestos expert says coloured sand poses 'very low risk'

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old man is behind bars after prosecutors alleged he pursued a woman into an underground car park where he tried to sexually assault her.

title.children: Canberra man denied bail over alleged car park sexual assault

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The mother of the 15-year-old boy who died in a car crash near Parliament House last year has spoken to one of the perpetrators involved during a court sentencing.

title.children: Mother of 15yo crash victim faces man who left him 'laying on the road'

image.altText: People dressed in white, all-body suits at the entrance to a building.

props.synopsis: The ACT has closed 70 schools over the coloured sand asbestos scare. Why is it the only jurisdiction to do so?

title.children: Why is the ACT the only jurisdiction to close schools over coloured sand?

image.altText: Three tower waterslides, all in a significant state of disrepair.

props.synopsis: Canberra's only water park will remain closed for the summer despite promises by the site's owners it would reopen by mid-November.

title.children: Big Splash confirms at 'eleventh hour' that water park will remain shut

image.altText: A woman plays with her son using blocks.

props.synopsis: A recall of children’s coloured sand after asbestos traces were found has led to the closure of multiple public schools in the ACT, leaving parents scrambling for care options and answers.

title.children: 'Chaos situation' as asbestos risk in coloured sand causes school closures

image.altText: Woman stands in front of microphones wearing blazer.

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal MPs have voted to replace Brad Battin with Jess Wilson to lead the party, as they look ahead to the next election.

title.children: Jess Wilson becomes first woman to lead Victorian Liberals

image.altText: A middle-aged man with grey-white hair wearing a grey T-shirt looks serious in front of a plain background.

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives is poised to take a significant step in the mammoth saga of the so-called "Epstein files". Here's how we got here.

title.children: After Trump's backflip on Epstein files vote, here's what we know

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit and tie looks down while sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Bank boss Matt Comyn has told a parliamentary hearing it's "unlikely" rates will move in the near term, including any reduction in the cash rate in 2026.

title.children: 'Unlikely' rates will move in 2026, CBA boss tells hearing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Cautious and data dependent' RBA board casts doubt on future rate cuts
Is the government's 5% deposit scheme risky?

image.altText: An image of the UN security council members voting.

props.synopsis: The UN Security Council approves a US plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force to provide security in the devastated territory.

title.children: UN Security Council backs US plan for Gaza

image.altText: An old lady walks down a street with buildings damaged by military strikes behind her.

props.synopsis: Russia enters Pokrovsk in Ukraine's east on motorcycles and in ramshackle cars with troops perched on the top, in what has been dubbed a "Mad Max-style" convoy.

title.children: Russian troops advance in 'Mad Max-style' convoy, desperate to take strategic Ukrainian city

image.altText: Penny Wong looks at Anthony Albanese at a press confernece

props.synopsis: Penny Wong has demanded "full accountability" and "transparency" from Laos over the methanol deaths of two Australian women last year. Follow live.

title.children: Wong says Laos methanol deaths investigation 'not good enough'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: McIntosh says future coal-fired power stations would have to be on a 'market basis'
Dan Tehan says young Australians want strong economy before action on climate change
Ley congratulates 'fresh, next gen' Jess Wilson after Victorian leadership ballot

image.altText: The Woden School sign on a building.

props.synopsis: More schools will reopen in Canberra on Wednesday with a list of current closures to be updated this afternoon.

title.children: List of ACT schools reopening tomorrow as coloured sand clean-up continues

image.altText: A pedestrian and cyclist goes across the Causeway footpath as traffic crosses on the road adjacent.

props.synopsis: The Boorloo Bridge, which connects Perth's inner southern suburbs with the CBD, will remain closed until at least Wednesday after lighting cables fell across the commuter structure on Monday.

title.children: 'The fastening didn't hold': New $198m bridge closed after safety issue

image.altText: Willem Duursma looks on during a game for Vic Country

props.synopsis: With the AFL draft just around the corner, see which picks each club has to work with and the players they could select.

title.children: AFL draft club by club: Every team's picks and potential targets

image.altText: Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain in a mohair cardigan, sitting with a semi-acoustic guitar for MTV's Unplugged.

props.synopsis: It was nearly a disaster, but Nirvana going acoustic for MTV ended up being one of the most iconic live performances ever and cemented Kurt Cobain as a tortured genius.

title.children: Kurt Cobain's most unnerving performance — and why he hated it

image.altText: A large storm cloud over the ocean.

props.synopsis: The fleet of the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race set sail from the harbour city, unaware they were travelling directly into the path of a huge storm and unrelenting swell that would throw the race into disarray and claim six lives.

title.children: How these crew members survived 'violent monster waves' at sea

image.altText: a small old urn

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

title.children: Think you know the Ashes? Try our fiendish quiz to find out

image.altText: Base of Mount Anne, Tasmania, photo by Ben Wilkinson

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were "reasonably prepared" but worsening weather meant they were cold, wet and unable to continue their journey.

title.children: Weather hampers rescue of hikers stranded on Tasmania's Mount Anne

image.altText: a teddy bear and flower sit outside an apartment complex

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old man pleaded guilty to murdering his three-year-old son in a unit in Sydney's south-west two years ago.

title.children: 'I'll probably get 30 years': Father admits to murdering toddler son

image.altText: Police at a crime scene in Caboolture.

props.synopsis: Police have shot dead an armed man found threatening a woman north of Brisbane.

title.children: Armed man shot dead by police after threatening woman, stabbing man

image.altText: Gloved hands use tweezers to examine pink coloured sand in a zip-lock bag.

props.synopsis: Dozens of schools remain closed in the ACT, Tasmania and South Australia today as the clean-up and disposal of potentially asbestos-laced coloured sand continues. What risk does it actually pose?

title.children: 'Don't panic': Asbestos expert says coloured sand poses 'very low risk'

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: The union has confirmed it will go ahead with protected industrial action on November 25, with teachers to walk off the job for a day.

title.children: Queensland teachers to strike for second time amid pay dispute

image.altText: Para-cyclist standing on the top step of podium, smiling, gold medal around her neck, holding flowers.

props.synopsis: Heartfelt tributes from across the Australian sporting landscape have flooded social media after the death of Paralympic and world champion para-cyclist Paige Greco.

title.children: Tributes flow after death of Paralympic champion Paige Greco

image.altText: Former FBI Director James Comey surrounded by journalists.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's critics describe Mr Comey's charges as part of a campaign by the president to chill opposition.

title.children: Judge finds 'profound' missteps in US probe of former FBI boss James Comey

image.altText: Four people standing outside on a windy day

props.synopsis: Normally confined to four walls, the Land and Environment Court holds a site hearing in the NSW Southern Highlands to hear residents' concerns about a proposed recycling plant.

title.children: Residents plead with court to reject proposed plastic recycling plant

image.altText: The sun sets on the horizon and against a pale blue sky you see endless rows of power lines and towers.

props.synopsis: A decade and a half after an energy company CEO outlined his greatest fears for Australia's economic future — no carbon price — the nation again appears set for a renewed battle over climate policy and power generation.

title.children: Who should we blame for power price hikes?

image.altText: Jake Paul puts his fingers to his lips

props.synopsis: Nobody plays at boxing. But Jake Paul's upcoming contest against a bona fide, former two-time unified heavyweight champion of the world smacks of a game about to go seriously wrong.

title.children: Boxing is no game, despite Jake Paul's increasingly dangerous charade

image.altText: Couple smiliing in a wedding picture, smiling at signing

props.synopsis: One year after Steven Tougher's killer was found not criminally responsible due to mental impairment, his wife says she has learnt to accept it.

title.children: Wife of slain paramedic says killer is getting the 'help he finally needs'

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie poses with a Russian passport in front of a Russian crest.

props.synopsis: Simeon Boikov, the pro-Putin propagandist hiding from authorities in the Russian consulate in Sydney, launches an extraordinary attack on his hosts, saying they are subjecting him to "prison-like conditions" in a bid to "push me out".

title.children: Pro-Putin propagandist enduring 'prison-like' conditions in Russian consulate

image.altText: A broad view of houses with solar panels on rooftop

props.synopsis: When there is an oversupply of solar and wind power, energy producers are paying more to deliver electricity to households than they get paid. Here's what we know about how it affects you.

title.children: Renewable energy generators need to cut out when sun blazes and wind blows

image.altText: Aerial view of a mining site. The dirt is orange and brown.

props.synopsis: A mine in South Australia's Murray Mallee is ceasing operations and says it will rehabilitate the site back to its original condition. However, the site's owner says the land will never get back to what it was before mining.

title.children: Landholder says mine company's promise to revegetate site not possible
